bug.author: zoq

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zoq>@zoq</denchmark-link> Unfortunately, no. It's been two years since I wrote the code, so this is now effectively someone else's code for me. Maybe <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> has an idea, he has an awesome memory!
I don't have an awesome memory, I just have lots of logs that I have to refer to... :) I'll look into this when I have a chance, hopefully in the next week or so.

When you say that it doesn't work, do you mean that it crashes or that its results are not good? If you have a test dataset and code I can use, that will help me figure out what is wrong. It seems like there is at least a problem with the termination condition for building the tree, like you pointed out.

I believe that I've fixed this in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/commit/5bd1e7cf7e0cdc545fe06aef98ce1a1f051b976c>5bd1e7c</denchmark-link> ; the issue was basically that the cosine nodes would not split at all when there were two points, so I changed the minimum number of points. In addition, the nodes would not split properly when there were only two points: the code (and the original equations in the paper) would cause both points to be in the left child, leaving an empty right child (which caused a failure). I also found a minor error in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/commit/0be5c054c6e94c5f1441f8483d8e5c0db8c9010c>0be5c05</denchmark-link> , which I fixed. I added the test you suggested to . If my fix didn't work, please reopen and I'll try again. :)

Hi there, thanks for the report (nice hostname by the way, I like it). I can't seem to reproduce this with regular BLAS/LAPACK. I suspect this may be a different issue than the original issue here; would you mind opening a new issue so we can debug it there? Also, if you can get me the versions of MKL, Armadillo, and mlpack (probably git master?) you're using, I can try and reproduce and then debug. Based on the way this looks I would not be surprised if it is an Armadillo or MKL bug (but I am not sure yet).
